title: Edmond Halley
summary: Edmond[1] (or Edmund)[2] Halley FRS (/ˈhæli/;[3][4] 8 November [O.S. 29 October] 1656[lower-alpha 1] – 25 January 1742 [O.S. 14 January 1742]) was an English astronomer, geophysicist, mathematician, meteorologist, and physicist. He was the second Astronomer Royal in Britain, succeeding John Flamsteed in 1720.
